GenAIRR.sequence package

Submodules

GenAIRR.sequence.heavy_chain module

class GenAIRR.sequence.heavy_chain.HeavyChainSequence(alleles, dataconfig: DataConfig)[source]

Bases: BaseSequence

Represents a heavy chain sequence in an immunoglobulin, including V, D, and J segments, along with NP1 and NP2 regions.

This class extends BaseSequence to include functionality specific to heavy chain sequences, such as sequence simulation with D segment and two NP regions, mutation, and functionality checks based on junction properties.

Parameters:

  • alleles (list) -- A list of Allele instances for the V, D, and J gene segments.

  • dataconfig (DataConfig) -- A DataConfig instance containing configuration data for sequence simulation.

check_stops(seq)[source]

Checks the given sequence for the presence of stop codons.

Parameters:

seq (str) -- The nucleotide sequence to check for stop codons.

Returns:

True if a stop codon is found, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

classmethod create_random(dataconfig: DataConfig)[source]

Creates a random instance of HeavyChainSequence with randomly selected V, D, and J alleles from the given DataConfig.

Parameters:

dataconfig (DataConfig) -- A DataConfig instance providing allele choices and other configuration data.

Returns:

A new HeavyChainSequence instance with randomly chosen alleles and simulated sequence.

Return type:

HeavyChainSequence

get_junction_length()[source]

Calculates the length of the junction region in the heavy chain sequence, taking into account the trimmed V, D, J segments and the NP1, NP2 regions.

Returns:

The total length of the junction region, including CDR3 and flanking conserved regions.

Return type:

int

mutate(mutation_model: MutationModel)[source]

Applies mutations to the heavy chain sequence using the given mutation model.

Parameters:

mutation_model (MutationModel) -- The mutation model to use for applying mutations to the sequence.

Updates:

The method updates the mutated sequence, mutations, mutation frequency, mutation count, junction sequence, and checks for functionality post-mutation.

simulate_sequence(dataconfig: DataConfig)[source]

Simulates the heavy chain sequence by trimming V, D, J alleles, adding NP1 and NP2 regions, and assembling the final sequence.

Parameters:

  • dataconfig (DataConfig) -- Configuration data for sequence simulation, including trimming dictionaries,

  • lengths (NP) --

  • probabilities. (and transition) --

update_metadata()[source]

Updates the metadata for the heavy chain sequence, including the start and end positions of the V, D, and J segments.

GenAIRR.sequence.light_chain module

class GenAIRR.sequence.light_chain.LightChainSequence(alleles, dataconfig: DataConfig)[source]

Bases: BaseSequence

Represents a light chain sequence in an immunoglobulin, including V and J segments and an NP region.

This class extends BaseSequence to include functionality specific to light chain sequences, such as sequence simulation, mutation, and functionality checks based on junction properties.

Parameters:

  • alleles (list) -- A list of Allele instances for the V and J gene segments.

  • dataconfig (DataConfig) -- A DataConfig instance containing configuration data for sequence simulation.

Inherits all attributes from `BaseSequence` and adds/modifies specific ones for light chain sequences.
check_stops(seq)[source]

Checks the given sequence for the presence of stop codons.

Parameters:

seq (str) -- The nucleotide sequence to check for stop codons.

Returns:

True if a stop codon is found, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

classmethod create_random(dataconfig: DataConfig)[source]

Creates a random instance of LightChainSequence with randomly selected V and J alleles from the given DataConfig.

Parameters:

dataconfig (DataConfig) -- A DataConfig instance providing allele choices and other configuration data.

Returns:

A new LightChainSequence instance with randomly chosen alleles and simulated sequence.

Return type:

LightChainSequence

get_junction_length()[source]

Calculates the length of the junction region in the light chain sequence, taking into account the trimmed V and J segments and the NP1 region.

Returns:

The total length of the junction region, including CDR3 and flanking conserved regions.

Return type:

int

mutate(mutation_model: MutationModel)[source]

Parameters:

mutation_model (MutationModel) -- The mutation model to use for applying mutations to the sequence.

Updates:

The method updates the mutated sequence, mutations, mutation frequency, mutation count, junction sequence, and checks for functionality post-mutation.

Simulates the light chain sequence by trimming V and J alleles, adding an NP region, and assembling the final sequence.

Parameters:

  • dataconfig (DataConfig) -- Configuration data for sequence simulation, including trimming dictionaries,

  • lengths (NP) --

  • probabilities. (and transition) --

update_metadata()[source]

Updates the metadata for the light chain sequence, including the start and end positions of the V and J segments.

GenAIRR.sequence.np_region module

class GenAIRR.sequence.np_region.NP_Region(transition_probs, first_base, length)[source]

Bases: object

Represents an NP region in an immunoglobulin sequence, where the base transitions are determined by a first-order Markov chain with position-specific transition matrices.

transition_probs

A dictionary where keys are position indices and values are transition matrices (dict) indicating the probability of transitioning from one base to another.

Type:

dict

first_base

The initial base of the NP region, used as the starting point for the Markov chain.

Type:

str

length

The total length of the NP region to be generated.

Type:

int

Parameters:

  • transition_probs (dict) -- Position-specific transition probabilities for base changes.

  • first_base (str) -- The starting base of the NP region sequence.

  • length (int) -- The desired length of the NP region sequence.

classmethod create_np_region(NP_lengths, NP_transitions, which_NP, first_base_dict)[source]

Class method to generate an NP region sequence based on specified lengths, transitions, the type of NP region (NP1 or NP2), and initial base probabilities.

Parameters:

  • NP_lengths (dict) -- A dictionary mapping NP region types (e.g., 'NP1', 'NP2') to their length distributions.

  • NP_transitions (dict) -- A dictionary mapping NP region types to their position-specific transition probabilities.

  • which_NP (str) -- Specifies the type of NP region ('NP1' or 'NP2') for which the sequence is generated.

  • first_base_dict (dict) -- A dictionary mapping NP region types to the distribution of possible initial bases.

Returns:

The generated NP region sequence. Returns an empty string if the specified length is zero.

Return type:

str

generate_np_seq()[source]

Generates an NP region sequence using a first-order Markov chain based on the provided transition probabilities and initial base.

Returns:

The generated NP region sequence. If the sequence generation is halted due to lack of data, the sequence is returned as is and its length is updated to reflect the actual generated length.

Return type:

str

next_base(current_base, position)[source]

Determines the next base in the NP region sequence based on the current base and position using the provided transition probabilities.

Parameters:

  • current_base (str) -- The current base in the sequence.

  • position (int) -- The current position in the NP region, used to select the appropriate transition matrix.

Returns:

The next base in the sequence, chosen based on the transition probabilities.

Return type:

str

validate_next_base(current_base, position)[source]

Validates whether transition data is available for the current base at the given position, ensuring that the Markov chain can continue.

Parameters:

  • current_base (str) -- The current base in the sequence.

  • position (int) -- The current position in the NP region.

Returns:

True if transition data is available and the sequence generation can continue, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

GenAIRR.sequence.sequence module

class GenAIRR.sequence.sequence.BaseSequence(alleles)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class representing a recombined Immunoglobulin (Ig) sequence, consisting of variable (V), diversity (D), and joining (J) gene segments.

This class provides a template for creating and manipulating Ig sequences, including features like (NP) regions, junctions, and mutations.

v_allele

The V gene allele.

Type:

Allele

d_allele

The D gene allele, if present.

Type:

Allele

j_allele

The J gene allele.

Type:

Allele

NP1_region

The nucleotide sequence of the NP1 region between V and D genes.

Type:

str

NP1_length

The length of the NP1 region.

Type:

int

NP2_region

The nucleotide sequence of the NP2 region between D and J genes.

Type:

str

NP2_length

The length of the NP2 region.

Type:

int

ungapped_seq

The complete ungapped nucleotide sequence.

Type:

str

gapped_seq

The complete nucleotide sequence with gaps.

Type:

str

mutated_seq

The ungapped nucleotide sequence after applying mutations.

Type:

str

gapped_mutated_seq

The gapped nucleotide sequence after applying mutations.

Type:

str

junction

The nucleotide sequence of the junction region (CDR3 plus anchors).

Type:

str

v_seq_start

The start position of the V segment in the sequence.

Type:

int

d_seq_start

The start position of the D segment in the sequence, if present.

Type:

int

j_seq_start

The start position of the J segment in the sequence.

Type:

int

v_seq_end

The end position of the V segment in the sequence.

Type:

int

d_seq_end

The end position of the D segment in the sequence, if present.

Type:

int

j_seq_end

The end position of the J segment in the sequence.

Type:

int

mutations

A string representation of mutation events.

Type:

str

mutation_count

The total count of mutations.

Type:

int

mutation_freq

The frequency of mutations in the sequence.

Type:

float

Parameters:

alleles (List[Allele]) -- A list of V, D (optional), and J gene alleles.

abstract get_junction_length()[source]

Abstract method to calculate the length of the junction region of the sequence. The junction region typically includes the CDR3 region along with conserved residues from V and J gene segments.

Returns:

The length of the junction region in nucleotides.

Return type:

int

abstract simulate_sequence(dataconfig: DataConfig)[source]

Abstract method to simulate the recombined nucleotide sequence including V(D)J recombination, trimming, and NP region addition based on provided data configurations.

Parameters:

  • dataconfig (DataConfig) -- An instance of DataConfig containing all necessary parameters

  • simulation. (and configurations for sequence) --

Returns:

The simulated nucleotide sequence, optionally including gaps.

Return type:

str
